text: Measurements.jl is magical. To think that I'll never have to bother manually deriving gigantic formulas for uncertainties... And it's so simple to use

elements.text: Measurements.jl is magical. To think that I'll never have to bother manually deriving gigantic formulas for uncertainties... And it's so simple to use

text: If you are not limited by computational resources, I would generally recommend <https://github.com/baggepinnen/MonteCarloMeasurements.jl> though, since linear error propagation can quickly break down, if your error is sufficiently large and the function sufficiently nonlinear (see <https://baggepinnen.github.io/MonteCarloMeasurements.jl/stable/comparison/>).
